record.title: CALENDAR WEDNESDAY
record.narrative:
CALENDAR WEDNESDAY -- (House of Representatives - March 12, 2008)

[Page: H1542]
record.chair: Today is the day of Calendar Wednesday. The Clerk will call the roll of committees.
record.narrative: Mr. SESSIONS (during the call). I have a point of parliamentary inquiry, Mr. Speaker.
record.chair: The gentleman from Texas may state his inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: I understand that the procedure that the Chair just went through is known as Calendar Wednesday. Is it correct that any bill reported by a committee and placed on the Union or House Calendar could have been called up by the chairman as the committee name was read?

record.chair: Calendar Wednesday business may be called up only on formal authorization by the reporting committee.

speaking.paragraph: A further point of parliamentary inquiry, Mr. Speaker.

On February 12, a bipartisan majority in the Senate passed S. 2248, a responsible bill to provide long-term authority for our intelligence community to help detect and prevent acts of terrorism. For a month now, it has been sitting at the desk in the House awaiting action. Would it have been in order for the chairman of the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence or the chairman of the Judiciary Committee or their designee to call up S. 2248 at this time?
Further point of parliamentary inquiry, Mr. Speaker.

H.R. 5440, the House counterpart to this bipartisan Senate legislation, was introduced by Congressman Fossella on February 14. Would it be possible for Mr. Hoekstra, the ranking member of the Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence, to call up this bill under his committee's jurisdiction or for any of the 21 members of the Democrat majority who signed a letter to Speaker Pelosi on January 28 asking her to move this legislation to "ensure a strong national security apparatus that can thwart terrorist attacks across the globe and to save American lives here in this country," for them to call up this bill?

record.chair: A committee member other than the chairman must have specific authorization of the committee to call up a bill on Calendar Wednesday.

speaking.paragraph: Further point of inquiry, Mr. Speaker.

Is it in order for any member of the minority to call up a long-term FISA modernization bill that would strengthen the Nation's intelligence capacities while protecting the civil liberties of Americans during the call of the committees?

record.chair: Again, a committee member other than the chairman must have specific authorization of the committee to call up a bill on Calendar Wednesday.

speaking.paragraph: I thank the gentleman for letting us know that it's up to the chairman or the Speaker.
